wikipedia_page.main: Kenji Takaki (10 March 1894 – May 1984) was a merchant seaman and actor in both the theatre and cinema. He was of Japanese descent and played small roles in a number of mainly British films as well as being a character extra in others.

link_mentions.page: The Long and the Short and the Tall (film)
The Long and the Short and the Tall (play)
response: * Japanese Soldier -  Doesn't speak at any point during the play, but still plays a major role (Kenji Takaki)

link_mentions.page: British merchant seamen of World War II
response: Records show that men from all British Commonwealth countries and most Scandinavian, Baltic and European countries served aboard British registered vessels and until the December 1941 attack on Pearl Harbor there were Japanese seamen amongst crews, several of whom were killed in U-boat attacks serving beside British colleagues,CWGC details Nabao Tanabe and others such as Kenji Takaki were captured and interned with British seamen at Marlag-Milag.
# Kenji Takaki – Japanese – prisoner in Germany 1940–45, later movie actor.
